creativecoding.tact

Class TactSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • creativecoding.tact.TactSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TactConstants

    public class TactSensor
extends Object
implements TactConstants

    A TactSensor represents a top-level capacitive Tact sensor.

    The following instanciation creates a sensor instances that will deliver signal spectra which start at 44 and contain 32 measure points with a step size of 2. The sensor instance will also store the 64 most recent TactSpectrum in its buffer.

     TactSensor s = tact.addSensor(0, 44, 32, 2, 64);
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    Steffen Fiedler, www.nand.io
    See Also:
    Tact.addSensor(int)

    • Field Detail

      • buffer

        public TactSpectrum[] buffer
        List of previously received signal spectra. This buffer thereby stores TactSpectrum instances in chronological order. The latest is located at the end (length - 1).
         TactSpectrum latest = sensor.buffer[sensor.length() - 1];
        The number of signal spectra that the buffer holds is defined by default through TactConstants.DEFAULT_SPECTRUM_BUFFER_SIZE, and can be modified when creating the sensor. 
         // Creates a sensor with a buffer size of 64
 tact.addSensor(0, 44, 32, 2, 64);
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        length()

      • bias

        public float[] bias
        Bias buffer storing the 1024 most recent values. Structured in chronological order is the latest value located at the end of the list.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        bias()

      • peak

        public float[] peak
        Peak buffer storing the 1024 most recent values. Structured in chronological order is the latest value located at the end of the list.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        peak()

    • Method Detail

      • push

        public void push(TactSpectrum b)
        Populates buffer with new new values set. This set (signal spectrum) that has been recorded with a Tact sensor at a specific point in time. The most recent (last) added TactSpectrum will always be located at the end of the buffer array.

        TactSpectrum recent = sensor.buffer[sensor.buffer.length - 1];

        When adding a new TactSpectrum, the bias and peak histograms will also be updated using the relevant attributes of the given buffer. This method is only used by the tact-core after processing the appropriate Serial events.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer that is about to be assigend to the existing set of TactSpectrum instances which have been recorded before.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        bias, buffer, peak, latestSpectrum()

      • pushBias

        public void pushBias(float bias)
        Parameters:
        bias -
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:
        bias

      • pushPeak

        public void pushPeak(float peak)
        Parameters:
        peak -
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:
        peak

      • mode

        public String mode()
        Data request and transfer mode between implementation and sensor.
        • TactConstants.BIAS, bias value only
        • TactConstants.BIAS_PEAK, bias and peak value
        • TactConstants.PEAK, peak value only
        • TactConstants.SPECTRUM, full spectrum. Including information about bias and peak.
        Returns:
        Data transfer mode as String.

      • hasBias

        public boolean hasBias()
        Flag if instance requests bias data from sensor.
        Returns:
        Returns true when bias data is available, otheriwse false.
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:
        bias, bias()

      • hasPeak

        public boolean hasPeak()
        Flag if instance requests peak data from sensor.
        Returns:
        Returns true when peak data is available, otherwise false.
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:
        peak, peak()

      • hasSpectrum

        public boolean hasSpectrum()
        Flag if instance requests full specturm data from sensor.
        Returns:
        Returns true when spectrum data is available, otherwise false.
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:
        buffer

      • movingAverage

        public TactSpectrum movingAverage()
        Generates a moving average (MAV) of the present buffer. Thereby all TactSpectrum will be included as subsets to compute the overall average per TactSpectrum.values datum.

        float[] mav = sensor.movingAverage();
        Returns:
        an array of float values that contains the moving avaerage of the present buffer.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        buffer, TactSpectrum.values

      • pin

        public int pin()
        Readable identifier of the TactSensor. This term has been defined with the instantiation of the sensor.

        sensor = Tact.addSensor(0);
        Returns:
        pin of the sensor as String
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        Tact.addSensor(int)

      • length

        public int length()
        Size of the sensor buffer. Thereby the number of TactSpectrum instances that will be stored in retrospective. Invoking this method is a short version for inspecting the length of the buffer manually:

        int l = sensor.buffer.length;
        Returns:
        number of TactSpectrum instances that will be stored in retrospective as int.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        buffer

      • latestSpectrum

        public TactSpectrum latestSpectrum()
        The method used for accessing the most recent processed Tact value set (signal spectrum). The result represents a Tact signal at a specific point in time, that has been added via push(TactSpectrum). It's taken from the internal buffer where it's located at the end of the array. To take hold manually:

        TactSpectrum s = sensor.buffer[sensor.buffer.length - 1];
        Returns:
        most recently assigned TactSpectrum; or a blank instance that has been instantiated by the TactSensor() constructor.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        buffer, TactSpectrum

      • latestValues

        public float[] latestValues()
        Most recent value set (signal spectrum). It thereby has been taken from the latest TactSpectrum which was assigned to the buffer and is meant to provide an easier access to the present raw signal.
         float[] set = sensor.latestValues();
 for (int i=0; i < set.length; i++) {
    System.out.println(set[i]);
 }
        Returns:
        an array of float[] values that present the Tact value set (signal spectrum).
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        TactSpectrum.values

        public float bias()
        Signal bias of the most recent spectrum.
        Returns:
        present sensor bias as float value.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        TactSpectrum.bias()

      • maxBias

        public float maxBias()
        Maximum bias value that has been measured so far. This value will be Float.MIN_VALUE if no signal has been received yet. Use resetBias() to reset this constrain.
        Returns:
        maximum bias value measured so far as float.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        minBias(), resetBias()

      • maxPeak

        public float maxPeak()
        Maximum peak value that has been measured so far. This value will be Float.MIN_VALUE if no singal has been received yet. Use resetPeak() to reset this constrain.
        Returns:
        maximum peak value measured so far as float.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        minPeak(), resetPeak()

      • minBias

        public float minBias()
        Minimum bias value that has been measured so far. This value will be Float.MAX_VALUE if no signal has been received yet. Use resetBias() to reset this constrain.
        Returns:
        minimum bias value measured so far as float.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        maxBias(), resetBias()

      • minPeak

        public float minPeak()
        Minimum peak value that has been measured so far. This value will be Float.MAX_VALUE if no signal has been received yet. Use resetPeak() to reset this constrain.
        Returns:
        minimum peak value measured so far as float.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        maxPeak(), resetPeak()

      • readings

        public int readings()
        Number of measurements taken from the sensor's signal spectrum. This value represents the amount of values that all TactSpectrum instances of this sensor in buffer can store; their length().
        Returns:
        0.1
        See Also:
        TactSpectrum.length()

      • readings

        public void readings(int readings)
        Sets the number of measurements (readings) taken from the signal of the sensor. The width of the read part results from this value times step, which represents the gap between the readings.
        Calling this method will invoke reset() to underline structural differences with previous spectra.
        Parameters:
        readings - number of measurepoints taken from the signal as int.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        reset()

      • start

        public int start()
        Start index of the delivered spectrum within the sensor signal. This value can be initially set when adding the sensor.
        Returns:
        Index within the signal where first measurement is taken as int.
        Since:
        0.1

      • start

        public void start(int start)
        Sets the start index of the of the spectrum within the sensor signal.
        Calling this method will invoke reset() to underline structural differences with previous spectra.
        Parameters:
        start - Index within the signal where first measurement is taken as int.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        reset()

      • step

        public int step()
        Step size for which measurments are made. The value -1 represents the number of units between all measure points.
        Returns:
        Step-width for made measures as int.
        Since:
        0.1

      • step

        public void step(int step)
        Sets the step width between all measure points. A step width of 3 results in a gap of two measure units between the resulting values.
        Calling this method will invoke reset() to underline structural differences with previous spectra.
        Parameters:
        step - number of measure units after which a reading will be made.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        reset()

      • receivedCount

        public long receivedCount()
        Number of received sensor updates since start or reset() call.
        Returns:
        Total number of received updates as long.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        reset()

      • resetBias

        public void resetBias()
        Resets bias() min and max values. Thoses are constantly checked and as the case maybe updated. This functions allows to reset those constrains by assigning Float.MAX_VALUE to minBias() and vice versa.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        minBias(), maxBias()

      • resetPeak

        public void resetPeak()
        Resets peak() min and max values. Those are constantly checked and as the case maybe updated. This function allows to reset those constrains by assigning Float.MAX_VALUE to minPeak() and vice versa.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        minPeak(), maxPeak()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets buffers and signal boundaries. Method is called when performing readings(), start() and step() setters to ensure comparability within present and previous TactSpectrum instances. Invoking this method will also reset the receivedCount.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        receivedCount(), readings(int), start(int), step(int)
